Key Match Events: Edson Álvarez saved Mexico from elimination with a goal in the 11th minute of second-half stoppage time.
Mexico beat Honduras 4-2 on penalty kicks to qualify for the 2024 Copa América.
César Huerta was twice allowed to retake his penalty kick in the shootout after two saves by Edrick Menjívar when the goalkeeper moved too early.
Andy Najar missed his penalty shot wide, leading to Mexican players celebrating.
Luis Chávez scored in the 43rd minute to tie the aggregate score 2-2.
Edson Álvarez scored 1 1/2 minutes after the nine minutes of stoppage time that was signalled.
Maldonado was given a yellow card in the 115th minute for pulling down César Huerta.
Santiago Giménez, Johan Vásquez, and Orbelin Pineda converted their penalties for Mexico.
Bryan Róchez's penalty was saved by Luis Malagón.
